title: Polynomial Functions - Describing Characteristics - Part A

content.description: The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.5</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2.6</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5.1</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5.6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4EFB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question:
Part A

On the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.5</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>1.2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, determine the absolute minimum output value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> and the absolute maximum output value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math>. Label your answers appropriately.

Part A

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
